title: Send Messages
content: I am unable to send or reply to messages. My top bar with those commands vanishes when I choose reply or compose. Help
creator: gdhutch

title: thunderbird snaps broke all content-handling applications
content:
When I upgraded my ubuntu system from 22.04 to 24.04, I was compelled to accept the conversion of thunderbird to snaps. Now none of the applications -- like http handler -- will run because snap maps them all to something under /run/usr/... AND THEY WON'T RUN FROM THERE I cannot even use Help to make a donation! I need to be able to get to vivaldi, firefox, libreoffice and others. Every time I enter one in the application box, the snapper remaps to /run/user/... I try to find that location and it's not there -- of course it won't run! -- and the application won't work. screenshots attached

Tell me how to roll back from v128.3.1esr to a version without snaps -- without losing 10 years worth of email!
creator: kmcaywood

title: Thunderbird download not accessible
content: I donated before downloading and now every iteration of "download" takes me to the donation screen and I cannot see how to get past it. (Once is enough:-)

title: Very slow TB
content: My (wonderful) Thunderbird is driving me nuts. A few weeks ago I decided that some housekeeping was in order. Everything was running fine, but some of my mailboxes had lots (thousands) of (POP) emails in them and so I decided to prune and archive. Since then TB is running very slowly, frequently displaying the "not responding" warning. I have searched "not responding" on the forum, but there are 117 PAGES of posts and finding even one that might be relevant to my situation is beyond the scope of my remaining lifespan! So I apologise if this has already been dealt with and in which case I hope some kind soul can point me in the right direction. I'm apparently using v 128.3.1esr on a 3 year old Dell XPS13 laptop running Win 10. Many thanks

title: userChrome.css not working
content:
Hi all,

I tried to change the appearance of thunderbird using a userChrome.css file.

  • I am sure it is located in the correct profile folder and has the correct name userChrome.css
  • The userChrome.css file is also visible in the style editor of the development tools and displays the correct contents if I edit the file.
  • I am sure that the toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets is set to true
  • I restarted tb millions of times

The contents of my userChrome.css file are currently (but I also played with different content):

/* Change background color for read messages */ treechildren::-moz-tree-row(read) { 

   background-color: #f1f715 !important;      color: #6564cf !important;

}

In the style editor, if i try to change the color code in one of the lines, it gives the following error messages:

Error while calling actor 'stylesheets's method 'update' document is null Actor.js:103:13 

   writeError resource://devtools/shared/protocol/Actor.js:103    handler resource://devtools/shared/protocol/Actor.js:242

InvisibleToDebugger: TypeError { } Actor.js:110:15 

   writeError resource://devtools/shared/protocol/Actor.js:110    handler resource://devtools/shared/protocol/Actor.js:242

I am running thunderbird 128.3.1esr (64-bit) on mac sonoma 14.6.1 (23G93)

Does anybody know how to get the style sheet running?

Thanks, ulrike
creator: ulrike.luxburg

title: Thunderbird on pc with 3 email accounts not able to send with 2 but do receive/send with 1 account
content:
For the past few weeks tried playing around with settings on pc with Thunderbird.

I managed some how to be able to send and receive emails with 1 of the 3 accounts i use.

Now the one that does both i have it as default in the outgoing server settings.

Below is the settings i have on it and is working but then i apply the same settings to the other 2 accounts and i receive emails but it wont allow to send i get some long text pop up window with error explaination with all numbers in it.

My settings for the account able to receive and send INCOMING Server Type --IMAP Mail Server Server Name--outlook.office365.com User name ****my email***hotmail.com Port 143 

Security Settings

Connection Security--STARTTLS Authentication Method OAuth2

Now for Outgoing

Outgoing Server (SMTP) Settings Description---outlook.office365.com Server Name---smtp.office365.com Port 587 Security Connection Connection Security--STARTTLS Authentication Method --OAuth2 User name *****my email***hotmail.com

So these settings above for one hotmail account works sends/receives but when i use the same settings mentioned above for the other 2 email accounts one being an hotmail.com and the other being an outlook.com email they do receive emails but cannot send emails.

Any suggestions much appreciated. I will try to post picture of what i get when i try to use those 2 other emails to send out.
creator: skycards

Suggestions?

Thank you.

title: When saving attachments from Thunderbird default directory shifts to "/run/user/1000/########" instead of the previously used directory location
content:
I have been experiencing strange behavior ever since I installed Thunderbird on my Pop_OS laptop. When I save an attachment from an email, I am by default routed to somewhere under "/run/user/1000" in a subdirectory with a random alphanumeric code where I can see the filename for the previous attachment I saved. I have to navigate back to / and down to the appropriate directory every single time.

When I try to save all attachments, I get a different problem. I can select from a list of previously used directories, but the operation always fails with "Unable to save the attachment. Please check your file name and try again later." and then "Unable to save the message. Please check your file name and try again later."

What would fix this behavior?

The About screen in Thunderbird says I am using 128.3.1esr (64-bit) - Mozilla Thunderbird Flatpak en-US thunderbird-flatpak - 1.0. I'm using Pop!_OS 22.04 LTS.

title: Cannot export/import mail between two thunderbird installations
content:
My Ubuntu computer's network interface has failed. I need to address that. Before doing so, possibly with an OS re-install, I need to export my (thunderbird) email.

Since my configuration is 2.9GB (i.e, > 2GB), I can't use the zip file. So I have rsync'd the email profile to a USB stick.

I want to import this into a clean new thunderbird location on another Ubuntu machine. I can find no way for Tb to import the copied files. Going through the documented procedure, Import Tool -> Import from another Tb installation -> Choose a profile folder -> "Import failed unexpectedly, more information may be available in the Error Console."

Where is the Error Console? I must be doing something simple and wrong. What is it? Or should I give up on Tb completely?
creator: gchunt

title: sincronização com contas hotmail

title: Thunderbird Message Pane won't redraw after message deleted

I am running TB 128.3.1esr (64-bit) on the latest Windows 10 (64).

All add-ins are disabled.

The error even happens in troubleshooting mode.

I am not sure what to try to fix it?

Thanks

title: Unable to log in at server - New account
content:
So, I've read through questions posed for this error, and still cannot get this new email account set up

I am trying to use an email address currently hosted with Godaddy, it is one of those Microsoft 365 Basic Essentials packs that GD forced on us a couple of years ago. Well I'm sick to the back teeth of them changing and updating stuff, so I need to open a new account here at Thunderbird.

Problem is when I enter my email and password in the new account setup, I initially get a 'Configuration found in Mozilla ISP database'. Then when I press DONE, I get the following message

'Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password'

I know the username and password are good, but how do I find out if there is a wrong configuration.

It auto selected POP3 in the available configurations

I turned of my firewall and AV as suggested in some of the comments when brought up previously, it didn';t help

Thanks in advance

Anybody help?

title: Permanently moving my TB email files to an external drive to recover C:// space without losing the old emails
content:
I have used TBird for many years and have thousands of emails that are not on a server, but that I use for reference, some more often than others. It’s taking up 227 GB on my new computer (which has a much smaller hard drive than in olden days), about half my hard drive. I don’t want to lose those emails, so I need to see if the email file can be permanently put on my external drive and deleted from C:// to save that drive from filling up. Is this possible and, if so, can someone tell me how to do it?

If there's already a post addressing this, I wasn't able to get the search to understand that I was not asking to archive or back up the files, but to make D:// the actual location. So if some knowledgeable person just wants to post a link to do this, I am very happy with that idea! Thank you! Thank you!! Paul

title: Today's Thunderbird update
content: I don't know what you guys have done with Thunderbird but, after using and updating Thunderbird on my desktop computers for almost 20 years, today's Thunderbird update (to Version 68) says I'm using an old version and I have to set up one or more new profiles. I'm not a tech guy and I don't understand what it is that I'm supposed to do. What you're asking is way beyond my capabilities... I've got better things to do in my business than try to figure out new Thunderbird profile setups for my multiple email addresses (including aliases). Now I have no access via Thunderbird to sending and receiving emails and my Thunderbird address book has disappeared... this is nuts! At least I can access my Outlook and Gmail accounts directly but I no longer have the consolidation and flexibility that Thunderbird gave me. Interestingly, I was planning to make another financial donation to support Thunderbird... but not now! Thunderbird should have automated this update process like all its previous updates!
creator: jimtodd1104

title: Missing or blank email messages and unable to move from one to another email message
content: I recently, a few weeks ago, removed tbird as my email service. This was due to messages coming in blank or as I scrolled from message to message down the incoming list the mail I WAS able to read never left the screen so I closed the instance of tbird and reopened it only to find that most of the following emails are now blank. I then installed outlook and hate it, very inefficient and later talked myself into retrying tbird. This fresh download and install worked well for maybe two days then the same things began to occur as they did in the previous install. Before, I got a canned answer to make sure that remote messages was checked and it now is, but to no effect. Im not quite sure why I would be directed to check an item that by default is not checked and worked fine until it didnt. So remote messages has no effect one way or the other. I replied twice that this was not the problem and got no response so I removed tbird. This all started about a month ago so I would urge you to check with your updates and see which one is responsible for this as tbird has been rock solid til after updates. God bless and please figure this out, I HATE outook!

title: Thunderbird inutilizzabile, va continuamente in loop
content:
Salve, all'improvviso Thunderbird non va più sul laptop. Si apre regolarmente, richiede regolarmente la password ma poi appare la rotella (la vecchia clessidra, per intenderci) e si resta per un pezzo. Se clicco in qls punto la pagina diventa opaca e continua a non fare nulla. Poi, dopo un bel po' di minuti si ferma e torna la freccia, ti lascia fare poco o nieinte e riparte con la rotella.

Il profilo che utilizzo è molto grande, sì (30GB), ma così di colpo mi pare strano che diventi ingestibile a questo modo. Ho provato ad aprire lo stesso profilo su un'altro pc dove ho thunderbird e mi ha dato il messaggio che quel profilo era stato creato da una nuova versione di TB. Ho installato l'ultima versione (o almeno, quella che viene proposta sul sito ufficiale) ma non cambia niente, mi dà sempre lo stesso messaggio. Se però provo ad aprire (sempre sul pc alternativo)un profilo che ho salvato a settembre, funziona regolarmente. Sono realmente nei guai, il profilo che uso è di lavoro e così ne sono di fatto escluso. Non ho il coraggio di installare l'ultima versione di TN anche sul laptop per paura che non me lo legga più nemmeno quello.

Se il problema fosse la dimensione del profilo, come posso fare per "smagrirlo" senza perdere dati? Non posso fare la compressione delle cartelle perché... non ci arrivo, parte la "rotella" al primo menu a tendina che apro...

Grazie a chiunque sappia darmi qualche aiuto.
creator: andrjiable

title: how to redownload from IMAP
content:
My wife's TBird "broke" yesterday. It would download messages from her IMAP server, report how many messages were downloaded, and they would then immediately disappear although they remain in her inbox on the IMAP server. We could not find them anywhere within TBird in any account or local folder on her system.

She brought this to my attention this morning.

  • I did an inbox repair
  • I reset training via Tools > Settings > Privacy & Security and selected "Reset Training Data"
  • I deleted all (2) of her message filters
  • I rebuilt her global message db per https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database

We are now at the point where she appears to be receiving emails normally again. However, the previous messages, which are still in her IMAP server's inbox, have not been recovered. They cannot be found on her TBird system, although they can be read when she connects to the IMAP server through their webmail interface.

There is a total of 54 messages in her IMAP inbox, 5 in her IMAP junk box, and about a dozen in other folders on the IMAP server. Total space on the IMAP server is under 9 Meg. Except for the 5 messages which arrived after the above steps, none of today's or yesterday's emails can be found on her TBird system.

Is there any way to tell Thunderbird to reread/redownload the messages in her IMAP inbox that somewhere it thinks it already did download?

(I'm reasonably tech-savvy; my wife isn't.)

Thanks for any guidance.
creator: firefox1888
